TopicTitle: Need a name for a Space Game concept

Articles.Content:
So Im writing up a plan for a 'firmish' Sc-fi space/air/ground MMO combat game which is sorta like WW2 in space with a bunch of added stuff. The only thing I really need is a name. (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1E5iPO4NrXEv2TNNn1xYRwOoGyqkOt9QGoruwWgM0C0c)

- - - Updated - - -

I left suggest on so people can, well suggest things.

I asked for permission, my email is [REDACTED]. It's just the one I use for google. I have a different email for personal use.

Edited September 20, 2015 by legoclone09
I thought that I set it up so anyone with the link could view.

Generic Space : Conquering it was never this easy!

or

*main race* Space Program

Or

you could take ideas from retro space games :

Space Invaders

Asteroids, among others.

The storyline is that sol and some other star that everyone knows (Polaris/Sirius or something) end up going to war and players can be ground pounders tank commanders, aircraft pilots, or combat Spacecraft pilots. Each battle lasts 24 hours and anyone who logs on during that time is put in that same map with Space, air and ground troops. The storyline restarts every whenever either of the sides home planet gets captured which can only happen after each of the stars in their empire gets captured, each planet in their home system and each moon around their homeworld.

- - - Updated - - -

note: to stop high level people from killing all the n00bs if you destroy someone too far below your own ships level you dont get anything.

I need a pretty neutral name cause I dont want to classify on side and the 'Baddies'. PS r4pt0r what do those mean?

PPS what should the other star be?
"Sol Invictus" means "Unconquered Sun", and Asteria was the Titan goddess of night time oracles and falling stars. I just coupled that with 2645 as a random sci-fi date.

"Sol Invictus" means "Unconquered Sun", and Asteria was the Titan goddess of night time oracles and falling stars. I just coupled that with 2645 as a random sci-fi date.

Why not 2552? It's a good, slightly subtle Halo reference.

A note to whoever decided that trolling a document with suggest was fun: I thought that the KSP forum was more mature than that, however it appears that the hard work of the moderators is all that keeps some of us in line.
UPDATED: Added Terrawatt and Exawatt cannons among other things
